top_categories.workout_context: 53ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Uwharrie Forest Gravel Grinder's Forest gravel, Uwharrie National Forest forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 75 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Uwharrie Forest Gravel Grinder's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before February.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Uwharrie Forest Gravel Grinder. Train it until it feels boring.
At Uwharrie Forest Gravel Grinder, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
75 miles on forest gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Uwharrie Forest Gravel Grinder, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
When someone attacks on forest gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Varied gradients on forest gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on forest gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Base fitness for Uwharrie Forest Gravel Grinder. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Uwharrie Forest Gravel Grinder’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Uwharrie Forest Gravel Grinder requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on forest gravel to build confidence. Expect: forest gravel, uwharrie national forest, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 75 miles of forest gravel in Central North Carolina (Uwharrie National Forest).
